sentences.sContent: Her family were so poor they couldn’t afford to buy her new clothes.
sentences.sCn: 她家穷得甚至买不起新衣服给她。

sentences.sContent: an area where poor people lived
one of the poorest countries in the world
sentences.sCn: 世界上最贫穷的国家之一

sentences.sContent: a poor part of Chicago (= where a lot of poor people live )
My grandparents grew up dirt poor (= very poor ) .
sentences.sCn: 我的祖父母在赤贫的环境里长大。

sentences.sContent: ...it is high time that both hospitals and patients should take some steps to deal with current poor relationship...
...The report warns that 200 million poor workers are at risk of joining the ranks of people living on less than 2 dollars per day in the past three years...
...Nobody flourishes in a gloomy environment with irresponsible staff and a poor safety record...
...Half a century later GM is a typical example of poor management...
...David Rossi reported that he had talked with Mclaughlin about his extremely poor driving record...
...a figure that rises to 50% in poor urban neighborhoods...
...Most people believe that reading in dim light causes poor eyesight...

synos.tran: 贫穷的；可怜的；贫乏的；卑鄙的

phrases.pCn: 切开中间夹肉干酪蔬菜等的大三明治
n. 管理不善，治理不善；经营粗放

words.tran: 身体不舒服的；心情恶劣的
贫穷地；贫乏地；不充分地

trans.tranOther: having very little money and not many possessions
